items.title: How will Sebi's new intraday limits impact equity index derivatives?
items.description: Sebi is tightening intraday position limits in equity index derivatives starting October 1, aiming to curb volatility and potential market manipulation, especially on expiry days. The new framework sets a ₹5,000 crore intraday net futures-equivalent position limit in index options, down from the existing ₹1,500 crore end-of-day cap.

items.title: Jane Street's $10.1-biilion trading haul sets Wall Street record
items.description: Jane Street Group achieved a record-breaking $10.1 billion in net trading revenue during the second quarter, surpassing major Wall Street banks. This surge, more than double the previous year's figure, propelled their first-half trading revenue to an unprecedented $17.3 billion. The firm benefited significantly from the market volatility spurred by President Trump's tariffs and subsequent investor repositioning.

items.title: Sugar stocks soar up to 20% as govt lifts ethanol curbs
items.description: Sugar stocks witnessed a surge following the central government's decision to remove restrictions on ethanol production from sugarcane. This move has boosted investor confidence in sugar companies. Analysts anticipate improved profitability and a potential rise in ethanol prices. The Supreme Court's stance on ethanol-blended petrol further supports the demand for ethanol. Rajshree Sugars and Shree Renuka Sugars experienced significant gains.

items.title: Stock Radar: Short-term traders look to buy Hindalco stock on dips; 20-DEMA acts as a support
items.description: Hindalco Industries, after breaking a key resistance in August 2025, is showing bullish signs. Despite a previous dip from an October 2024 high, the stock has been trending upwards since April 2025. Experts suggest short-term traders consider buying on dips, targeting Rs 750 in the coming weeks.

items.title: Yes Bank shares in focus following CCI’s approval for SMBC stake acquisition
items.description: Yes Bank’s shares are in focus following the Competition Commission of India’s approval of Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation’s (SMBC) stake acquisition via secondary purchase from SBI and seven other banks. This regulatory nod is a key step, though completion depends on customary closing conditions. Yes Bank shares closed flat at Rs 19.56 on Tuesday.

items.title: Dividend stocks: 60 stocks including ONGC, OIL go ex-dividend tomorrow – last chance to buy!
items.description: Investors aiming for dividend payouts from PSUs should note today's deadline. Buying shares of Oil India Limited, NTPC, and ONGC today ensures eligibility for final dividends. These stocks will trade ex-dividend tomorrow, September 4, 2025. Several other companies, including A-1 Limited and AIA Engineering Limited, have also declared dividends with the same record date.

items.title: NTPC among 5 Nifty stocks showing RSI Trending Up on September 2
items.description: On September 2, five stocks in the Nifty50 pack appeared in the RSI Trending Up scan, based on data from StockEdge.com. An upward trend is signaled when the RSI (Relative Strength Index) crosses above 50 from below. "RSI trending up" indicates that RSI values are rising, suggesting strengthening momentum in a stock's price. This is often interpreted as a potential sign of upward movement and may be used by traders to identify buying opportunities.

items.title: Eternal shares in focus as Zomato hikes platform fee to Rs 12 amid festive demand surge
items.description: Zomato's parent company, Eternal, is in focus as the food delivery platform has increased its platform fee to ₹12 before the festive season, following a similar move by Swiggy. Both companies are investing heavily in quick commerce. Zomato reported a profit decline but revenue growth, while Swiggy's losses doubled due to Instamart investments.

items.title: Reliance Power, Aster DM among 6 stocks closed crossing above VWAP
items.description: On September 2, the closing prices of six stocks in the Nifty500 pack rallied over 1% relative to their VWAP (Volume Weighted Average Price). A shift above the VWAP suggests a potential bullish trend, according to technical scan data from StockEdge.com.When the closing price rises above the VWAP, it indicates that the stock closed higher than the average price at which it was traded throughout the day, with the average weighted by trading volume. This is often interpreted by traders and investors as a bullish signal, potentially reflecting positive market sentiment.

items.title: At multi-year highs: Eicher Motors, MRF among 6 stocks witness 5-year swing high breakout
items.description: In the NSE list of stocks with a market cap over Rs 10,000 crore, six stocks witnessed a 5-year swing high at the close on September 2, suggesting bullishness in counters, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data.A 5-year swing high represents the highest price a stock has reached within a five-year timeframe. This level acts as a significant resistance point where the price has historically struggled to go beyond. This occurrence may be seen as a bullish sign, indicating the potential for further upward movement in the stock. However, it's worth noting that this is different from a 5-year breakout, which occurs when a stock's price surpasses a key resistance level that has held for five years or longer.

items.title: Stocks to buy in 2025 for long term: Suzlon, Inox Wind among 5 stocks that could give 12-36% return
items.description: Brokerages remain upbeat on select stocks across renewables, infrastructure, and real estate, projecting healthy upsides in the near to medium term.We have collated a list of recommendations from top brokerage firms from ETNow and other sources:

items.title: Current Infraprojects IPO lists today. GMP hints at strong debut
items.description: Current Infraprojects is set to debut on the NSE SME after a highly successful IPO, oversubscribed by 379 times. The IPO, priced at ₹80 per share, saw significant interest from retail, NII, and QIB investors.

items.title: Sattva Engineering shares to debut today. Check GMP ahead of debut
items.description: Chennai's Sattva Engineering Construction is set for its SME debut today, following a highly successful IPO that was oversubscribed 198 times. The Rs 35.38 crore IPO, priced at Rs 75 per share, saw significant interest across all investor categories, particularly from non-institutional investors.

items.title: Positive Breakout: These 8 stocks close cross above their 200 DMAs
items.description: In the Nifty200 pack, eight stocks' close prices crossed above their 200 DMA (Daily Moving Averages) on September 2,2025, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data. The 200-day daily moving average (DMA) is used as a key indicator by traders for determining the overall trend in a particular stock. As long as the stock is priced above the 200-day SMA on the daily time frame, it is generally considered to be an overall uptrend. Take a look:

items.title: Wall Street ends lower as ruling on Trump tariffs raises concerns
items.description: Wall Street experienced a downturn on Tuesday, influenced by uncertainty surrounding President Trump's tariffs after a court ruling deemed them largely illegal. Investors are also anticipating the upcoming U.S. payrolls report amidst concerns of weak job growth. The Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq all declined. While real estate suffered, PepsiCo saw gains due to activist investor interest.

items.title: GIFT Nifty down 50 points; here's the trading setup for today's session
items.description: Equities experienced a slight downturn on Tuesday, reversing earlier gains driven by positive macro data due to profit booking. Investors are keenly awaiting the GST Council meeting. Technically, the daily RSI indicates a bearish trend, with support at 24,500 and resistance at 24,700. The rupee weakened to a record low of 88.15 against the US dollar.

items.title: Stocks in news: Vikran Engineering, Indus Towers, Waaree Energies, TCS, YES Bank
items.description: Domestic equities closed lower despite positive macro data, influenced by caution ahead of the GST Council meeting. Several companies are in focus, including Vikran Engineering and Anlon Healthcare, debuting on the exchanges. Indus Towers plans expansion in African markets, while Waaree Energies will acquire a 64% stake in Kotson.

items.title: Treasuries stabilize after debt-sale jitters and budget concerns rattle markets
items.description: Treasuries stabilized in Asian trading following corporate-debt sales and budget worries that impacted bonds and stocks. US 30-year bond yields remained near 5%, affecting tech shares, while Japan's ultra-long bonds also declined. Investors are navigating economic data, tariffs, Fed policy, and fiscal outlooks as the S&P 500 experiences minimal gains.

items.title: Can Smartworks maintain its growth momentum after a 29% surge since IPO?
items.description: Smartworks Coworking Spaces has shown strong performance since its IPO, gaining 29%, driven by robust June quarter results. With 1.1 million sq ft of space to be handed over soon, the company anticipates margin growth in the second half of FY26. They are targeting 30% revenue growth in FY26, leveraging an expanding operational footprint and long-term client relationships.

items.title: Amanta Healthcare IPO subscribed 23 times on Day 3 so far; GMP at 8%. Should you bid?
items.description: Amanta Healthcare’s Rs 126 crore IPO was subscribed 23.04 times, driven by NIIs and RIIs. Trading at an 8% GMP, the stock may list around Rs 136. The company’s sterile liquid pharmaceuticals focus and global certifications position it for strong growth.

items.title: GST rate cut: What's in store for 36 lakh ITC shareholders? Jefferies analysts decode
items.description: ITC shares have delivered no returns in two years amid GST, BAT stake sale, and Marlboro concerns. Jefferies expects revenue-neutral GST changes, which could ease investor worries and support steady cigarette industry growth.

items.title: From tariffs to tech: US listings regain momentum
items.description: A slew of companies across sectors launched U.S. IPO roadshows on Tuesday, marking the start of the fall window for new listings.

items.title: TBO Tek shares surge 12% after $125 million Classic Vacations acquisition
items.description: TBO Tek shares jumped 11.61% to Rs 1,541.30 on NSE after announcing the acquisition of US-based Classic Vacations for up to $125 million. This strategic move will boost TBO Tek’s global footprint in the luxury travel market, combining advanced technology with Classic Vacations’ established luxury travel network and five decades of industry experience.

items.title: Indus Towers shares drop 5% to 52-week low amid investor concerns over Africa entry
items.description: Indus Towers shares fell 5% to a 52-week low after the board approved a strategic international expansion into Nigeria, Uganda, and Zambia. While the move aligns with the government’s push for global growth, investors appeared cautious due to risks like regulatory hurdles, geopolitical instability, and cost pressures. The plan leverages Indus’s ties with Bharti Airtel in African markets.

items.title: Anlon Healthcare shares make a muted D-Street debut, shares list at 1% premium over IPO price
items.description: Anlon Healthcare shares had a muted debut, listing slightly above its IPO price after a nearly 7x subscription. The company plans to use the Rs 121 crore raised for expansion and debt reduction. Despite a limited operating history and regulatory risks, Anlon's strong financial growth, expanding product portfolio, and regulatory approvals make it a compelling long-term investment.

items.title: Vikas Khemani sees broad-based rally to fuel markets; bets on financials, pharma
items.description: Vikas Khemani expects a broad-based market rally, with financials, pharma, and manufacturing leading the charge. He sees large-caps offering stability while mid- and small-caps could outperform once sentiment improves, noting that short-covering and renewed buying may follow if tariff issues ease in the coming months.

items.title: Japan’s reflation trade: Foreign firepower, domestic caution
items.description: Foreign buyers have been the main drivers of Japanese equities, lifting the Topix 34.2% from its April lows. The rally has coincided with yen appreciation, yet Japanese retail investors remain largely absent from the momentum.

items.title: Zerodha hit by technical glitch, users face login & price update issues
items.description: Zerodha Down News: India's leading retail brokerage, experienced a technical glitch on Wednesday morning, causing price updates to freeze on its app. Users flocked to social media to report the issue, though order placement remained unaffected. Zerodha advised clients to use the Kite web platform as a temporary workaround.

items.title: Ashish Kacholia-invested Vikran Engineering shares list at 3% premium over IPO price
items.description: Vikran Engineering made its stock market debut on Wednesday after receiving strong interest for its Rs 772 crore IPO, which was subscribed nearly 25 times. The stock listed at a modest premium - Rs 99.70 on BSE and Rs 99.00 on NSE - against the issue price of Rs 97. The IPO was backed by noted investors Ashish Kacholia and Mukul Agarwal.

items.title: Sugar stocks trap investors in ethanol hype time & again. Is this rally a multi-year opportunity?
items.description: Sugar stocks are rallying due to government ethanol production decisions. Investors are hopeful, but past rallies have not always yielded long-term gains. Good monsoons and ethanol-blended petrol are positive factors. Analysts have mixed opinions on the sector's long-term sustainability. Ethanol prices and cane supply are key factors to watch. Some companies are better positioned to benefit.

items.title: Waaree Energies shares in focus on Rs 192 crore acquisition of 64% stake in Kotson’s Pvt Ltd
items.description: Waaree Energies is set to acquire a 64% stake in Kotson’s Private Limited for ₹192 crore, aiming to bolster its position in the power value chain. The acquisition, expected to close by September 30, will grant Waaree Energies greater control over supply and product quality. Additionally, Waaree Energies will acquire 100% shareholding in Impactgrid Renewables for ₹1 lakh.

items.title: Bajaj Finance among Axis Securities’ top 15 stock picks with upside potential of up to 29%
items.description: Indian equity markets have navigated a volatile landscape over the past few months, with mixed performances across sectors, market caps, and styles. Despite the fluctuations, select high-conviction baskets have outperformed. Axis Securities’ Top Picks Basket delivered a 16.2% return in the last six months, outpacing the 10.4% gain by the Nifty 50, and delivering a flat MoM return in August, still ahead of the Nifty’s 1.4% decline. Since its inception in May 2020, this basket has generated a remarkable 324% return, significantly higher than the Nifty 50’s 164% over the same period.With optimism building around festive demand and a likely earnings upgrade cycle in the second half, Axis Securities has revealed its Top Picks across large, mid, and small cap segments—well-positioned to benefit from India’s resilient growth outlook for a horizon of next one year:

items.title: Premier Energies, Ola Electric, UPL among 6 stocks crossing below VWAP
items.description: On September 2, the closing prices of seven stocks from the Nifty200 index dropped over 1% relative to their VWAP (Volume Weighted Average Price). A shift below the VWAP suggests a potential bearish trend, according to technical scan data from StockEdge.com.When the closing price falls below the VWAP, it indicates that the stock closed lower than the average price at which it was traded during the day, with the average weighted by trading volume. This is often interpreted as a sign of increased selling pressure.

items.title: Sensex slips 100 pts, Nifty below 24,600 as banks & IT weigh ahead of GST meet
items.description: Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty experienced a decline on Wednesday, primarily influenced by the downturn in banking and IT sectors. Investors exhibited caution in anticipation of the GST council meeting, where potential rate cuts on various goods are expected. The S&P BSE Sensex fell by 0.16%, while the NSE Nifty 50 also dropped by 0.16%.

items.title: CG Power shares zoom 14% in 4 days; here’s what’s driving the rally
items.description: CG Power shares have increased following the launch of India's first OSAT facility in Sanand, Gujarat. CG Semi, a subsidiary, launched the facility. Morgan Stanley initiated coverage with an 'Overweight' rating. The company is investing significantly in two facilities. These facilities are expected to create jobs.

items.title: Geopolitical risks make selective investing crucial, warns Nilesh Shetty
items.description: Nilesh Shetty in an interview to ET Now said that India’s GDP growth surprised on the upside and festive demand is expected to add momentum. Yet, global risks and valuations will determine investor strategies ahead of GST announcements.

items.title: Markets pin hopes on GST meet as cyclical revival gains traction: Varun Goel
items.description: As the GST Council convenes, investors anticipate announcements that could influence market sentiment. Expert Varun Goel predicts FY26 as a potential turning point for India's GDP growth, fueled by monetary easing and tax cuts, benefiting consumption and capex. Corporate earnings are expected to rise significantly, particularly in auto, consumer durables, and staples sectors.

items.title: Gold’s record run: can central banks keep the rally alive?
items.description: Gold prices climbed to a historic $3,532 per troy ounce, marking a 90% surge since late 2022. The rally has been fuelled by strong central bank buying, robust investment flows, and heightened global uncertainty. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Promoters selling, retail investors buying. Who's right? Raamdeo Agrawal answers
items.description: Despite Indian promoters offloading record shares, retail investors remain bullish, says Raamdeo Agrawal. Promoter shareholding fell to an eight-year low, while domestic institutional investors' share rose to a record high, surpassing foreign investors. Agrawal likens the market to expensive Mumbai property, advising investors to accept slightly higher prices for long-term growth.

items.title: Focus on value as GST, festive season and global risks shape markets; selective opportunities in logistics, pharma: Nilesh Shetty
items.description: India’s GDP growth and festive demand boost optimism, but Nilesh Shetty warns that valuations and global risks demand caution. He favours financials, IT, pharma, and logistics while trimming autos. Capital goods and staples look overpriced, while gold and silver remain secondary. Selectivity and long-term focus are key.

items.title: GST uncertainty weighs on auto stocks; 10 counters to benefit from rate changes: Sunny Agrawal
items.description: Auto stocks slipped as investors await clarity on GST hike for luxury cars and EVs. Analysts say the impact hinges on whether the higher tax applies to vehicles above Rs 20 lakh or Rs 40 lakh, with M&M largely shielded if the latter prevails.

items.title: JM Financial turns bullish on consumption, bearish on banks & infra. Check portfolio details here
items.description: JM Financial has rebalanced its model portfolio, turning bullish on consumption sectors like autos, consumer, cement, internet, hotels, and real estate, while cutting exposure to banks, NBFCs, insurance, infrastructure, ports, and defence, citing fiscal constraints and weak credit growth as key concerns.

items.title: Tata Steel and other metal stocks rally up to 6% on China capacity curbs, policy support
items.description: Metal stocks rallied on Wednesday with Tata Steel up 6%, as China’s production curbs and India’s tariff protection boosted sentiment. The Nifty Metal index rose 2.5%, led by Tata Steel, Jindal Steel, SAIL, and JSW Steel, with analysts seeing firmer steel prices ahead.

items.title: Retail investors raising stakes in small-cap stocks for 4 straight quarters — but are they winning?
items.description: Retail investors have steadily raised their stakes in 128 smallcap stocks over the last four quarters, up to June 2025—signaling growing confidence in emerging companies. But over 100 of these stocks have witnessed negative price returns in the past year, suggesting that most retail investors are currently in the red. (Retail investor - resident individuals holding nominal share capital up to Rs 2 lakhs)

items.title: European shares recover as bond selloff stabilizes ahead of US data
items.description: European shares climbed on Wednesday, bouncing back from steep losses in the previous session, as a selloff in longer-dated bonds appeared to stabilize, while investors awaited U.S. job openings data.

items.title: Cyclically negative, structurally positive: Will cement be a surprise winner? 9 cement stocks with an upside potential of up to 27%
items.description: In some sectors, it is better to own a basket of shares rather than have exposure to a single stock. Reason: When a sector goes through a phase of restructuring and consolidation, the chances are high that a set of winners will emerge. But it is tough to figure out which the winners will be. So, buy a basket. Also, unlike in the past when buying a basket of stocks was a cumbersome process, today it is just a click away. Now, why cement? Because it might be a surprise winner. What makes that sector a surprise winner? When fundamentals are changing, but scepticism levels are still high. Cement is a sector which has probably seen the maximum mergers and acquisition in the last three years and that suggests there has been a change in the operating matrix.

items.title: Anlon Healthcare shares make a tepid debut. Should IPO investors wait or sell?
items.description: Anlon Healthcare’s shares debuted with a modest 1% premium amid volatile pharma markets, despite a strong 7.12x IPO subscription driven by retail investors. The specialized API manufacturer showed robust financial growth, with revenue up 81% in FY25 and expanding profit margins. While niche products and global approvals boost prospects, risks include limited operating history and regulatory challenges. Analysts consider the IPO fully priced.

items.title: Mukul Agrawal, Ashish Kacholia-backed Vikran Engineering shares rise 5% from IPO price. Time to cash out or double down?
items.description: Vikran Engineering’s shares rose about 5% on debut, listing slightly above its Rs 97 IPO price in a Rs 772-crore offering backed by investors Mukul Agrawal and Ashish Kacholia. Despite strong subscription and a robust order book, gains fell short of grey market expectations. Analysts recommend holding for long-term growth supported by government infrastructure spending and the company’s asset-light model.

items.title: Time to think beyond correction & volatility? 7 small-caps from different sectors with upside potential of 13% to 50%
items.description: We are in turbulent and confused times, at least where the market is concerned. Sentiment on the street swings with each statement by an Indian minister or a US official, or President Trump himself. One way to deal with this is to sit it out. But if you are a smart investor with a long-term perspective you will be wondering whether this is the opportunity you have been waiting for. You may also be wondering whether, after an extended correction, small-cap stocks are at a stage where you should start looking at them? Perhaps. But you need to be smart about picking the right stocks.

items.title: Apollo Micro Systems shares rally 4%, extend winning streak to 4 days
items.description: Apollo Micro Systems shares: Apollo Micro Systems hit a new 52-week high at Rs 303 on Wednesday, extending gains for the fourth session. The stock has surged 160% in six months, outperforming defence peers like Astra Microwave, BEML, Paras Defence, and BEL.

items.title: GST, tariffs, and market moves: Manishi Raychaudhuri decodes what investors should watch out for
items.description: India’s GST meeting may cut tax slabs on discretionary items, potentially boosting consumption if benefits reach consumers. Global trade tensions, especially U.S. tariffs, pressure exporters, while rising bond yields reflect inflation concerns. Precious metals remain safe-haven favorites amid geopolitical risks, keeping investors cautious yet opportunistic.

items.title: Ola Electric shares skyrocket 55% in a month, analysts see further rally till Rs 90
items.description: Ola Electric's shares are rebounding strongly. The stock has increased significantly in the past month. This is due to positive technical indicators and PLI scheme approval. The approval allows Ola to receive incentives until 2028. Analysts predict further gains, with potential targets of Rs 80-90. However, the company reported a net loss in the June quarter.
